X-Yahoo-Profile: joeraii

Hi Julian,

I wrote Modular NEAT for my undergraduate thesis at UT; so, the GECCO
paper was kind of a distillation of the thesis, with a little extra work
on measuring modularization. If you're interested, I put the thesis itself
is in the files section of this group (honors-thesis.ps.gz). That version
is a little heavier on the implementation and analysis side, so it might
be helpful to you.

Unfortunately I haven't put any work into it since finishing the GECCO
paper, though I am working on a GRN-based system that I hope to get some
results on by the next GECCO deadline. Anyway I still have a ton of ideas
for modular NEAT, and I'd love to see the work continue on it. I think the
results were pretty clear that its a powerful optimization, at least for
some types of domains.

As for the source code, I've been planning for a while now to make a
formal release of it, but I really haven't had a lot of time to go over
the code. I'd be more than happy to package it up and send it to you in
its current state, and to answer any questions you have, but, the code
itself is not well-documented (much less so than Ken's original NEAT code
:P) and probably needs to be rewritten. Let me know if you're interested
though; I can at least point out the really obscure implementation details
for you.

Joe

-- 

Joseph Reisinger
http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/joeraii


On Thu, 2 Dec 2004, Julian Togelius wrote:

>
>
> Hi,
>
> I'm a beginning research student at University of Essex, UK (more on
> me at http://julian.togelius.com) and I'm also new to this group. My
> idea of the research I wanted to do was something very like modular
> neat until I found out about the project a few weeks ago...
>
> As I haven't been able to figure it out from the forum, I'll ask my
> question here: what is the current status of modular neat? Has any
> experiments been carried out since publication of the paper? Is anyone
> planning any? And is it possible to have a look at the source code for
> modular neat?
>
> Cheers
> Julian
>
